text:
Proposed changes to the output of the vssget task:

1. When the quiet attribute is set to true, vssget should still output a single
line like the standard tasks do.  Something like:
   [vssget] Retrieving $/MyProject to C:\MyProject

2. Suppress this stderr output when using the localpath attribute:
   [vssget] Set C:\MyProject as the default folder for project $/MyProject?(Y/N)N

3. When an error occurs, asterisk out the password when printing the command
line that failed:
BUILD FAILED
file:C:/MyProject/build.xml:106: Failed executing: ss Get $/MyProject -YRon,********
creator: bogofilter+apache.org@gmail.com

text:
1. This should be up the user of the task, a simple <echo> will give the desired
result, with out forcing it on all users.

2. This output can be usefull, if you have 'autoresponse=Y' then this line of
output can alert you to possible changes in your environment.

3. I've implemented this, although I feel the real solution is to use a generic
read-only account in the build file.

Jesse
creator: jesse@cryptocard.com

text:
Created attachment 5111
Patch to remove the password from the build failed output
creator: jesse@cryptocard.com
